--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon=
 Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> You can get an overview of the functionality =
at this wiki page:
> 
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/P=
recedence+Feature+Notes
> 
> For more detail and custom policies, you'll ne=
ed to dig into the source 
> code for the related classes (as listed on tha=
t wiki page), and possibly 
> implement your own subclasses.
> 
> Some thou=
ghts about using these functions:
> 
> =95 some related benefits can also b=
e addressed with the 'budgeting' 
> (CostAssignmentPolicy) features =96 ess=
entially nudging the crawler to 
> spend proportionately more time on some =
queues than others
> 
> =95 the queue and URI precedences were designed wit=
h the idea that there 
> would be a handful (or maybe dozens) of tiers, not=
 hundreds or thousands 
> =96 so I wouldn't rely on this (especially the UR=
I precedence) for very 
> fine-grained control. (In particular, many URI pr=
iorities means many 
> different insertion points for varied URIs in a sing=
le queue, which 
> means more disk seeks/less cache efficiency on the queue=
 structures.)
> 
> =95 URIs only get their precedence when initially enqueu=
ed; they can't be 
> reprioritized within their queue later. (Queues can ha=
ve their 
> precedence changed as their size/contents/other-heuristics chan=
ge.)
> 
> Hope this helps,
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> 
> On 4/15/11 1:50 AM, t=
ashev85 wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hello Gordon,
> >
> > I am working on a customiz=
ation of Heritrix and I need exactly those two features. However, I could n=
ot find any information on how to use them. Could you please explain in mor=
e detail (or point me to the documentation) how to assign priorities to dif=
ferent queues while running a job and how to assign priorities to URIs when=
 they are inserted into the queues.
> >
> > Thanks in advance.
> >
> >
> >>=
 If you want your prioritization to also take effect within the standard
> =
>> Heritrix frontier queues, there's a (seldom-used) pair of features,
> >>=
 queue and URI 'precedence' values, which affect (1) how inactive queues
> =
>> are sorted while waiting for their chance to be active; (2) where URIs
>=
 >> are inserted into individual queues (if all the other factors which
> >=
> affect whether they are pushed-near-the-top or queued-to-the-back are
> >=
> equal).
> >>
> >
> >
> >
> > ------------------------------------
